Review: Visually great. Story goes at a snails pace though. I wouldn’t say it overstays it’s welcome but it definitely drags on a bit.
Phenomenal turns from the cast - Mason particularly pulling out all stops as a truly pathetic grotesque creature. Comedy black as pitch.
Crowe and Gosling are a great pairing. Loadsa fun.

Review: ‘Husbands and chickens. The bane of my life.’
Well that was great. Not even the Goo Goo Dolls could ruin it.
Really meandering, clunky, pretty dull and not hugely funny. Tony Kebbell was great though. The rest seemed to be phoning it in a bit.
Good fun, sweet, warm hearted, emotional, funny. Candy was a king.
It is definitely Carols younger brother, but still really enjoyable, and Curry is great. Curry is always great. The biggest letdown really is Jim Hawkins is a lousy drip.
The best war movies tend to big up the brotherly love - and The Great Escape is no exception. A timeless classic.
